main event: A pilot observed a bright bluish-white glow in the eastern sky while flying a Boeing 707 over South Africa on February 15, 1964.
interesting points: The glow was observed to be spherical and about 8 inches in diameter,The object remained stationary in relation to the aircraft during the observation,The glow changed from a spherical shape to an elliptical shape as the sky brightened,The incident occurred at an altitude of 35,000 feet, just prior to sunrise, and the observation lasted around 10 minutes,The pilot and co-pilot, along with the crew, witnessed the phenomenon.
witness description: Captain R. H. Miller, co-pilot, and crew of South African Airways
